content.description: A short problem on the right side of the boulder going through some crimps and a jug rails into a sloping topout.
content.location: Start on the right corner of the boulder just right of the tree. Pull up through some crimps into a jug rails and topout from there.

content.description: The "direct" version of Chucks Roof making a really fun and big dyno to the lip.
content.location: Start on the double crimps, move right to the pinch crimp and Dyno straight up to the lip, skipping anything in the middle.

content.description: A little warmup traverse to play around on.
content.location: Start on the twin crimps in the middle of the face towards the road and traverse right through some so so holds into some jugs through the topout.

content.description: A sloppy traverse with a less than ideal fall. Worth the go if you have the pads and/or spotter for it. PS. Use more pads than the photos
content.location: Start all the way on the right corner of the right side of the boulder. Traverse left through sloppy holds and some crimps to a jug. Continue left under the tree, topping out at the tip of the prow.  The entire lower slab is off.

content.description: Fairly clear line straight up the middle of the wall facing the road into a committing, but fun move to the overhanging lip.
content.location: Located right in the middle of the side facing the road. Stand/squat start on the double crimps and go straight up into a subpar pocket and up into the lip.

content.description: Small boulder with a slight overhang at the top that offers some fun mid-grade climbing. Be sure to bring pads and spotter a because some of the landings aren't ideal. It got its name from the1970s 'Death Dive Mantle' problem that starts with a jump from the boulder in front to the point of the overhang.
